intro: Osbeckia chinensis var. parasnathensis, commonly known as the parasnathensis willow herb, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, particularly India and Nepal. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial species belonging to the family Montiaceae. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often covered with fine hairs. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open areas such as grasslands and along riverbanks.
